Row.Text: Lost Nordic Settlement

A band of explorers have approached us for patronage to seek out a lost nordic settlement, founded in ancient times by our ancestors. In exchange for gold to cover expenses, and a bit of the glory, if successful, this settlement will be claimed in the name of the empire.[NEWLINE]
Fund this expedition immediately!
That seems a waste of state funds.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain a free Settler, two free Scouts, and a free Kontreadmiral[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Nothing[ENDCOLOR]
We have become patron to an expedition to seek out a lost nordic settlement.
We have refused to patronise an expedition to seek out a lost nordic settlement.
Pietist Movement

Certain members of our faith, led by the theologian Philipp Spener, contend that our religious elite are corrupted by greed and impiety. A movement calling for the revival of a more devout, traditional style of {1_ReligionName} has begun, and they appeal to us to embrace their ideals.[NEWLINE]
Yes. Let us adopt a more pietist faith.
Bah. This is sacriligious nonsense.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {1_Num} {2_Yield}[ENDCOLOR]
We have embraced the ideals of Pietism.
We have rejected the ideals of Pietism.
Christian VI Denmark-Norway has embraced the ideals of the Pietist Movement.
Christian VI Denmark-Norway has rejected the ideals of the Pietist Movement.
Norwegian Tensions

Our Norwegian subjects have become discontent with our rule being centred on Copenhagen. Some of the more radical elite are beginning to discuss the creation of an independent Norway, whilst others merely wish for a greater devolution of powers to Christiania. Something must be done to settle these tensions before they become a threat to the Dano-Norwegian union.
Let us re-locate our capital to Christiania.
Very well. Let us grant greater autonomy unto Norway.
We shall tour Norway. A visit from their sovereign shall distract them.
We shall not act to appease these ingrates.

We have conceded to the upset of our Norwegian realm by re-locating our capital to Christiania. This has upset many of our Danish officials in Copenhagen, however.
We have conceded to the upset of our Norwegian realm by conferring upon them greater autonomy. This has upset some of our Danish officials in Copenhagen, however.
We have embarked upon a ten-day tour of our Norwegian realm. This seems to have put to rest any talk of independence, and has impressed our Danish officials in Copenhagen.

We have embarked upon a ten-day tour of our Norwegian realm. Though this has impressed our Danish officials in Copenhagen, it has not satisfied all, and secessionist rebels have risen up against us in Norway.
We have decided against acting upon the discontentment in our Norwegian realm. This seems to have come to no fault, and our show of conservatism has impressed our Danish officials.
